Jx.Styles

Dynamic stylesheet class.  Used for creating and manipulating dynamic stylesheets.

TBD: should we handle the case of putting the same selector in a stylesheet twice?  Right now the code that stores the index of each rule on the stylesheet is not really safe for that when combined with delete or get

This is a singleton and should be called directly, like so

// create a rule that turns all para text red and 15px.
var rule = Jx.Styles.insertCssRule("p", "color: red;", "myStyle");
rule.style.fontSize = "15px";

Summary
Jx.StylesDynamic stylesheet class.
Functions
getCssRuleretrieve a reference to a CSS rule in a specific style sheet based on its selector.
insertCssRuleinsert a new dynamic rule into the given stylesheet.
removeCssRuleremoves a CSS rule from the named stylesheet.
getDynamicStyleSheetreturn a reference to a styleSheet based on its title.
enableStyleSheetenable a style sheet
disableStyleSheetenable a style sheet
removeStyleSheetRemoves a style sheet
isStyleSheetDefinedDetermined if the passed in name is a defined dynamic style sheet.

Functions

getCssRule

getCssRule: function(selector,
styleSheetName)

retrieve a reference to a CSS rule in a specific style sheet based on its selector.  If the rule does not exist, create it.

Parameters

selector<String> the CSS selector for the rule
styleSheetName<String> the name of the sheet to get the rule from

Returns

<CSSRule>the requested rule

insertCssRule

insertCssRule: function (selector,
declaration,
styleSheetName)

insert a new dynamic rule into the given stylesheet.  If no name is given for the stylesheet then the default stylesheet is used.

Parameters

selector<String> the CSS selector for the rule
declaration<String> CSS-formatted rules to include.  May be empty, in which case you may want to use the returned rule object to manipulate styles
styleSheetName<String> the name of the sheet to place the rules in, or empty to put them in a default sheet.

Returns

<CSSRule>a CSS Rule object with properties that are browser dependent.  In general, you can use rule.styles to set any CSS properties in the same way that you would set them on a DOM object.

removeCssRule

removeCssRule: function (selector,
styleSheetName)

removes a CSS rule from the named stylesheet.

Parameters

selector<String> the CSS selector for the rule
styleSheetName<String> the name of the sheet to remove the rule from, or empty to remove them from the default sheet.

Returns

<Boolean> true if the rule was removed, false if it was not.

getDynamicStyleSheet

getDynamicStyleSheet: function (name)

return a reference to a styleSheet based on its title.  If the sheet does not already exist, it is created.

Parameter

name<String> the title of the stylesheet to create or obtain

Returns

<StyleSheet> a StyleSheet object with browser dependent capabilities.

enableStyleSheet

enableStyleSheet: function (name)

enable a style sheet

Parameters

name<String> the title of the stylesheet to enable

disableStyleSheet

disableStyleSheet: function (name)

enable a style sheet

Parameters

name<String> the title of the stylesheet to disable

removeStyleSheet

removeStyleSheet: function (name)

Removes a style sheet

Parameters

name = <String> the title of the stylesheet to remove

isStyleSheetDefined

isStyleSheetDefined: function (name)

Determined if the passed in name is a defined dynamic style sheet.

Parameters

name = <String> the title of the stylesheet to remove
